A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
Full Disclosure - I'm a Star Trek Fan.

That being said\, however - I've genuinely enjoyed EVERY Star Wars movie (including the original 3 - not being attached to the fandom allowed me to enjoy these films in their at the time state of the art CGI and big budget glory).

However - this film.. I cannot abide.
 - "Trigger Happy flyboy" is a line actually used in this film
 - Slapstick humor\, the "Disneyfication" that ruined Guardians of the Galaxy 2\, is strong with this one.
 - THERE IS NO SOUND IN SPACE. However\, in the Star Wars universe there is excessive sound in space but an AT-AT on Salt plains makes no sound whatsoever.

There's more after the spoilers BUT suffice it to say - the one element of this film that\, going in\, I believed I'd hate was the only one I truly enjoyed. 

I want to see a film with just the Porgs.

[SPOILERS]

 - Apparently skywalkers can bring themselves back to life.
 - Luke commits suicide (? like\, honestly wtf - he projects himself onto the battlefield so he can't be killed then just vanishes??? IS IT THE MIIDICHLORIANS??)
